clinical_study.official_title: Immediate Implant Breast Reconstruction for Patients With Mastectomy Ans Post opérative Chest Wall Radiotherapy

lead_sponsor.agency: Institut du Cancer de Montpellier - Val d'Aurelle

clinical_study.source: Institut du Cancer de Montpellier - Val d'Aurelle

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to study the impact of the immediate implant breast reconstruction for patients with mastectomy and postoperative chest wall radiotherapy

clinical_study.why_stopped: autorities vorbidden this dispositif in other trial

primary_outcome.measure: Success is defined as a complete therapeutic sequence (surgery + RT) without any significant complication at 6 months.
primary_outcome.time_frame: confirm the feasibility of the therapeutic sequence at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Success is defined as a complete therapeutic sequence (surgery + RT) without any significant complication at 6 months. Significant complication is defined as: Any event delaying RT (delay surgery/RT > 3 months) Any event preventing patients from receiving radiotherapy within 6 months after surgery

secondary_outcome.description: The rate of Baker grades 3/4 capsular contracture

other_outcome.description: Cosmetic results: assessed by both the surgeon and patient (patient satisfaction will be evaluated using a self-questionnaire). Photographs of the breast will be taken at different times (Pre / per / postoperative) and the picture analysis will be reviewed by an independent committee.
Functional results: patient satisfaction will be evaluated using a self-questionnaire

other_outcome.measure: The rate of patients requiring breast implant removal
other_outcome.description: The rate of patients requiring breast implant removal
Study of the indesirable effect of the radiotherapy on the implant

intervention.description: Eligible patients will undergo radical mastectomy with axillary lymph nodes sampling followed by immediate and single-stage breast reconstruction using the acellular dermal matrix Strattice™

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically confirmed breast carcinoma
- Patients planned for mastectomy with immediate single stage breast reconstruction using an acellular dermal matrix (Strattice™, LifeCell Corporation)
- Patients planned to receive postoperative chest wall irradiation
- Age ≥ 18 years old
- WHO performance status 0-1
- Affiliation to a social security system
- Informed consent signed prior any study specific procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inflammatory breast cancer
- Tumors with extensive involvement of the skin
- Use of tissue expander
- Indication of postoperative chemotherapy
- Patients planned for bilateral mastectomy
- History of previously treated ipsilateral breast carcinoma
- Usual contraindications for ADM
- Medical debility precluding surgical treatment
- Psychological, social, geographical disorders or any other condition that would preclude study compliance (treatment modalities and study follow-up).
- Pregnancy or breast feeding
- Inability to attend or comply with interventions or follow-up scheduling, disability or difficulty preventing a proper understanding of trial instructions
- Legal inability or restricted legal ability
